U.S. Forces urged to abandon jurisdiction
    Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- The all-people measure committee for schoolgirls Sin Hyo Sun and Sim Mi Son killed by a U.S. armored car reportedly held a news conference in front of the back gate of the "government" building in Kwanghwamun, Seoul, on Sept. 6 and demanded the U.S. Forces transfer jurisdiction over the murder of the two schoolgirls to south Korea.
 In a statement it accused the U.S. and the south Korean authorities of having resorted to conception from the day when the case occurred. Without eliminating the inequity of the south Korea-U.S. "status of forces agreement", it would be impossible to prevent the repeated crimes by U.S. troops, it said. It demanded a thorough investigation into the case, the U.S. Forces' abandonment of the jurisdiction and overall revision of the "status of forces agreement".
